meanings.definition: A word formed from a verb and used as an adjective.
meanings.sent1: In the sentence, 'The running dog is fast,' 'running' is a participle describing the dog.
meanings.sent2: I saw the painted house on the corner of the street.
meanings.sent3: The singing bird outside my window woke me up with its beautiful melody.
meanings.sent4: The glowing embers of the campfire warmed us as we sat around it.
meanings.sent5: The barking dog alerted us to the arrival of our guests.

meanings.definition: A verb form ending in -ing or -ed used to form tenses or adjectives.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys reading books in her free time.
meanings.sent2: The excited children were playing in the park.
meanings.sent3: The annoying buzzing of the mosquito kept me up all night.
meanings.sent4: The howling wind outside made the windows rattle.
meanings.sent5: The baking bread filled the house with a delicious aroma.
